author: Coral Barry
title: Bayern Munich legend Philipp Lahm confirms he is retiring at the end of the season
text:
Philipp Lahm has played for just two clubs (Picture: Getty) Philipp Lahm has confirmed he will retire at the end of the season, ending his Bayern Munich contract a year earlier than expected.
Steven Gerrard sends classy message to retiring team-mate The Bayern full-back still has a year left on his current deal and had been locked in negotiations with the club over an extension.
But the 33-year-old has now decided to hang up his boots.
‘I will quit at the end of the season,’ Lahm told reporters after Bayern’s win over Wolfsburg.
Lahm has also been a regular in the Germany international side (Picture: Getty) A Champions League trophy in 2013 completed Lahm’s club trophy set (Picture: Getty) ‘I think this is the right point in time to leave this summer.’
Lahm has enjoyed a remarkable career at Bayern winning seven Bundesliga titles and lifting the Champions League trophy in 2013.
The Germany international is also a World Cup winner with his country and made his 500th appearance for Bayern this week.
Lahm came through Bayern’s youth ranks and has only ever played for one other club, Stuggart.
